ARTICLE.TITLE: Linden: Store worker, 71, assaulted with crowbar and robbed of $400
ARTICLE.TEXT:
LINDEN – Police are looking for a man who allegedly assaulted a 71-year-old convenience store worker with a crowbar before stealing $400 from the store.

At about 4:10 p.m. Sunday, police responded to the Quick Mart Food Store, 701 Knopf St., for a report of a robbery, police said.

The employee told police the suspect entered the store, assaulted him with a crowbar and stole $400 before fleeing the store, heading west on Knopf Street toward Rahway, police said.

READ:NJ cold case: Still no arrest in 2012 Linden High School grad's slaying

The worker was treated for minor injuries at Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital Rahway and later released, police said.

Police said the suspect is described as a white man with a tattoo on his shoulder wearing a red bandanna, sunglasses, grey cut-off shirt, blue shorts, blue sneakers and an American flag face mask.

Anyone with information that can help identify this individual is urged to contact Detective Juan Velarde at 908- 474-8552.

Email: srussell@gannettnj.com

Suzanne Russell is a breaking news reporter for MyCentralJersey.com covering crime, courts and other mayhem. To get unlimited access, please subscribe or activate your digital account today.
